features.name: Kayako Brand Configuration
features.description: Configure and validate the Kayako brand name for messenger integration through the Connectors settings interface.
test_scenarios: Add valid Kayako brand name and verify it saves successfully
Add invalid brand name and verify validation error message appears
Clear existing brand name configuration and verify it saves as empty
Verify brand name is validated against Kayako API (https://{brandname}.kayako.com/api/v1/brands.json)
Test with special characters in brand name
Test with very long brand name
Test network timeout during validation (10 second timeout)

features.name: Messenger Script Injection
features.description: Automatically inject Kayako Messenger JavaScript widget on all public pages when configured.
test_scenarios: Verify script is injected on public pages when brand name is configured
Verify script is NOT injected on admin pages
Verify script is NOT injected on host pages
Verify script is NOT injected in Edit mode
Verify script is NOT injected in popup windows
Verify script is NOT injected when brand name is empty
Verify correct brand name is used in injected script URLs
Verify script includes correct Kayako API URL (https://{brandname}.kayako.com/api/v1)
Verify script includes correct messenger URL (https://{brandname}.kayakocdn.com/messenger)
Verify script includes correct realtime URL (wss://kre.kayako.net/socket)

features.name: HTTP Module Registration
features.description: Register and unregister the Kayako HTTP module in web.config for script injection functionality.
test_scenarios: Verify HTTP module is registered in web.config during installation
Verify HTTP module is registered in both system.web/httpModules and system.webServer/modules
Verify HTTP module is removed from web.config during uninstallation
Test module installation and verify it doesn't break other modules
Verify module handles errors gracefully without breaking page load

features.name: Connector Interface Implementation
features.description: Implementation of IConnector interface for integration with Evoq Connectors framework.
test_scenarios: Verify connector appears in Connectors list with correct name 'Kayako'
Verify connector icon displays correctly (Kayako.png)
Verify connector type is 'Marketing' category
Verify SupportsMultiple returns false (single instance only)
Verify HasConfig returns true when brand name is configured
Verify HasConfig returns false when brand name is empty
Test GetConfig returns correct brand name from portal settings
Test SaveConfig persists brand name to portal settings

features.name: Localization Support
features.description: Support for localized error messages and UI labels.
test_scenarios: Verify 'Brand Name' label displays correctly in UI
Verify 'The brand name is invalid.' error message displays for invalid brand
Test with different language settings if available
Verify resource file is properly deployed during installation

features.name: Module Package Installation
features.description: DNN module package installation and deployment of connector files.
test_scenarios: Install module package and verify all files are deployed
Verify Evoq.KayakoMessengerConnector.dll is deployed to bin folder
Verify RestSharp.dll dependency is deployed to bin folder
Verify Resources.zip contents are extracted correctly
Verify module requires CoreVersion 09.02.00 or higher
Verify module requires Evoq.Library 01.00.00 or higher
Test module upgrade from previous version
Test module uninstallation removes all files and settings

features.name: Messenger Widget Functionality
features.description: The actual Kayako Messenger chat widget that appears on pages after configuration.
features.ui_location: Bottom-right corner of public pages (typical messenger position)
test_scenarios: Verify messenger widget loads and displays on page
Test messenger widget can be opened and closed
Verify widget connects to correct Kayako brand instance
Test widget behavior with invalid brand name
Verify widget doesn't interfere with page functionality
Test widget appearance on mobile devices
Verify widget loads asynchronously without blocking page
